title: Events and IObservable
description: Meadow has two complementary approaches to notifications when interrupts (changes) happen on inputs. The first is the classic .NET Eventing pattern, in which an event is raised on change, and the second is an IObservable pattern, which is a more powerful and flexible reactive-style approach.

frontMatter.title: Events and IObservable
frontMatter.subtitle: Understanding how to handle interrupts and notifications in Meadow.
